data.prompt:
Extract comprehensive customer insights from reviews about Single Pole Toggle Switches.
The output format is JSON in English:
{
"phy": {
"<PHYSICAL>": {
"<PID>@<DETAIL>": {
"<SENT>": [ID, …]
}
}
},
"perf": {
"<PERF>": {
"<perf_id>@<DETAIL>": {
"<SENT>": {<PERF_REASON>: [ID, …]}
}
}
},
"use": {
"<USE>": {
"<SENT>": {<USE_REASON>: [ID, …]}
}
}
}

Definitions:
- <PID>: Unique ID for physical aspect ("phy"), starting from A. After Z, continue with AA, AB, and so on.
- <PHYSICAL>: Components or inherent physical properties of the Single Pole Toggle Switches without external interaction (e.g. dimensions, appearance, material type...)
- <DETAIL>: A self-contained detail summarized from the reviews.
- <SENT>: Sentiment polarity of the current <DETAIL> (- for negative, + for positive).
- ID: All review IDs mentioning the <DETAIL>
- <perf_id>: Unique ID for performance or functions ("perf"), starting from a. After z, continue with aa, ab, and so on.
- <PERF>: The Single Pole Toggle Switches' performance (e.g. flexibility, durability, ...) or behaviors under various conditions (e.g. temperature, force, chemicals...) without reference to any specific use case
- <PERF_REASON>: <PID> of the <PHYSICAL> explicitly mentioned as the cause of the <PERF>. Include all mentioned <PID>s. If no reason is mentioned, use "?". <PERF_REASON> and <PERF> should have the same sentiment polarity in the review where they are mentioned together (i.e. the same review ID are included at both locations)
- <USE>: The specific application, applicable object, method, tool, or environment for the product.
- <USE_REASON>: <perf_id> or <PID> causing the <USE>'s sentiment. Include all mentioned reasons, or "?" if none can be inferred. <USE_REASON> and <USE> should have the same sentiment polarity in the review where they are mentioned together.

CRITICAL INSTRUCTIONS:
- <PHYSICAL>/<PERF> and <DETAIL> MUST NOT include:
  * Generic statements without details (e.g., "good", "bad quality")
  * Issues unrelated to the product itself (e.g., "fast shipping", "delivery time")
- If a review mentions any physical aspect, related performance, or use together, extract them as separate entries under "phy," "perf," and "use," with no overlap.
- Make sure each <DETAIL> is under the most relevant <PHYSICAL> or <PERF> in the context of Single Pole Toggle Switches
- Preserve negations

Key Instructions:
- Break down reviews with multiple aspects, performances, or uses into individual entries.
- Escape special characters with backslash that could cause JSON syntax errors.
- Include only explicitly mentioned reasons, and use "?" where no reason is mentioned.

Final Checklist:
- Go through all reviews and ensure that no aspect, performance, use, or reason is omitted, even if only mentioned once.
- Review all entries to ensure proper separation between aspects, performances, and uses.

Print the JSON result only.
Input format:
<ID>#<review>

[[INPUT]]
0#Very good quality. Great quality replacing all tge cheap ones from Lowes
1#Made in Mexico Not USA. Worked as it should, great screw install instead of back push ins. Other that made in Mexico, I have no complaints.
2#Useful. These are a little cheaply made but work great got me
3#heavy-duty, tight, positive action. We needed a few heavy-duty switches for use where our behaviorally challenged son uses them. He has broken many paddle-type switches and plates. This design forces him to use a finger to flip the switch rather than slap the wall, hard. they have nice, tight action, and the box is noticeably more stout than the usual contractor special.
4#Good Shop Switch. Good feeling throw when you flip on and off.
5#leviton 54521-2w 20 amp single-pole switch . i used it on a 15 amp circuit , the switch looked very sturdy . the switch was very quiet (when operated), worked well for what I was using it for.no problems so far. no problems using 14 awg wire on it.
6#Did not have back wiring as stated in the description. Back wiring not available on the switch I received.
7#Perfect. It also works well in areas where 220V is used. It is easy and convenient to install.
8#Great product super value for it’s price. I use it to replace a magnetic contact switch which prove to be much much more durable plus the operation is a lot more easier and smoother.
9#Not 'back wired', terminal screws barely long enough for two 12 gauge wires. Wish I had paid more attention - these have terminal screws instead of the back-wiring clamps, and getting two 12-gauge wires properly under the terminal screws was difficult. For the price these should have the back-wiring clamps.
10#Good quality. Installation was easy and the switches have a nice look for a residential application.
11#Excellent Product. Easy to install. It arrived in excellent condition
12#Would buy it again.. Easy to install..
13#Good product. Good product
14#Turns stuff on and off. It operates as one would expect and looks of good quality.
15#Dead on arrival. One of the two I got was broken, took me a while to figure out it wasn't the wiring.
